intro: Hieracium albidulum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with ray florets that are shorter than those of other hawk's-beard species. Hieracium albidulum is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
